prompt_template: Answer the following question with only 'yes' or 'no': {question}
critique:
- Require an exact single-token answer. Change prompt to explicitly: "Respond with exactly one of the two tokens: yes or no." Rationale: prevents "Yes.", "Nope", "Yes\n" etc. Test: responses must equal "yes" or "no" byte-for-byte.

- Enforce lowercase ASCII and no punctuation/quotes/spaces. Add: "(lowercase ASCII letters only, no punctuation, no quotes, no leading/trailing whitespace, no newline)". Rationale: removes capitalization/formatting variance. Test: "Yes" → reject; "yes" → accept.

- Limit output length. Add: "Maximum length: 3 characters." Rationale: ensures only "yes" or "no" fit. Test: any response >3 bytes fails.

- Define fallback for non-binary or ambiguous questions. Add: "If the question cannot be answered strictly yes/no, respond 'no'." Rationale: avoids extra text or clarification requests and yields deterministic behavior. Test: non-yes/no question → "no".

- Block explanations. Add: "Do not include any explanation, justification, or additional words." Rationale: prevents appended sentences. Test: "yes because..." → reject.

- Put constraints before the question in the template. Example template: "Instruction: [constraints]. Question: {question}" Rationale: priority of constraints increases compliance. Test: run with different questions and check first token only.

- Provide positive/negative examples in the prompt. Include 2–4 test cases, e.g. "Example: 'Is a whale a mammal?' → yes. 'Is the sky a colorless gas?' → no." Rationale: few-shot examples improve consistency. Test: assistant matches example style.

- Treat output as exact-match for grading. On the verification side, enforce exact-match check against the set {"yes","no"} and mark any deviation as failure. Rationale: makes reward signal aligned with prompt constraints. Test: automated checker rejects "Yes." and accepts "yes".

Applying these changes will make model behavior deterministic and easier to grade automatically, raising the chance of higher reward.
